bestBHT.bht: To see the Lord, we must diligently pursue peace with all and strive for sanctification. Following after peace means actively seeking moral and spiritual ends, while sanctification requires consecration and becoming holy as God is holy. Without holiness, we cannot enter into the presence of the holy God, and it is through holiness that we are able to appreciate and enjoy Him. Therefore, our part is to put on His holiness and be sanctified, so that we may have communion with Him both in this life and in the life to come.

Henry Alford: Follow peace with all, and sanctification, without which none shall see the Lord.
Looking well lest any one falling short of the grace of God, lest any root of bitterness springing up—trouble you, and by its means the many be polluted.
Lest there be any fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one meal sold his own birthright.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Our part is to put on His holiness, becoming 'holy as He is holy,' by sanctification.
Without holiness in them, they could not enjoy Him who is holiness itself.
None but the holy could appreciate the holy God, none else therefore shall abide in His presence.
Albert Barnes: Follow peace with all men - Do not give indulgence to those passions which lead to litigations, strifes, wars.
In such times they were in great danger of giving indulgence to evil passions, and hence, the special propriety of the exhortation to endeavor to be holy.
No one has ever been admitted to heaven in his sins; nor is it desirable that anyone ever should be.
Marvin Vincent: The verb is used of the pursuit of moral and spiritual ends.
John Calvin: Unless then we strenuously labor to follow peace, we shall never retain it; for many things will happen daily affording occasion for discords."

As however peace cannot be maintained with the ungodly except on the condition of approving of their vices and wickedness, the Apostle immediately adds, that holiness is to be followed together with peace.
He declares, that without holiness no man shall see the Lord; for with no other eyes shall we see God than those which have been renewed after his image.
Philip Schaff: Follow peace with all, and holiness... without which no man shall see the Lord.
Archibald T. Robertson: Follow after peace (ειρηνην διωκετε). Give peace a chase as if in a hunt.

With all men (μετα παντων). Like Paul's use of διωκω with ειρηνην in Romans 14:19 and his to εξ υμων (so far as proceeds from you) in Hebrews 12:18. This lesson the whole world needs including Christians.
Sanctification (αγιασμον). Consecration as in 1 Thessalonians 4:7; Romans 6:19, etc.
John Gill: To 'follow peace', signifies an eager pursuit after it, in the use of proper means; exerting the utmost of a man's power to attain it, in all things possible.

Peace is no further to be followed than is consistent with holiness; and holiness here does not design any particular branch of holiness, as chastity of the body and mind, but the whole of holiness, inward and outward.
Holiness is necessary to see the Lord, to have communion with Him in this life, and to behold His glory in heaven.
John Wesley: The not following after all holiness, is the direct way to fall into sin of every kind.

bhtAttempts.bht: To see the Lord, we must diligently pursue peace with all and strive for sanctification. Following after peace means actively seeking moral and spiritual ends, while sanctification requires consecration and becoming holy as God is holy. Without holiness, we cannot enter into the presence of the holy God, and it is through holiness that we are able to appreciate and enjoy Him. Therefore, our part is to put on His holiness and be sanctified, so that we may have communion with Him both in this life and in the life to come. It is crucial to pursue peace and holiness together, as peace cannot be maintained with the ungodly without compromising on their vices and wickedness. In our pursuit of peace and holiness, we must be diligent and use all possible means to attain them, understanding that without holiness, we cannot see the Lord and have a genuine relationship with Him.

To see the Lord, we must diligently pursue peace with all and strive for sanctification. Without holiness, we cannot enter the presence of the holy God, and through holiness we can appreciate and enjoy Him. It is crucial to pursue peace and holiness together, as peace cannot be maintained while compromising on the ungodly's vices. We must actively seek moral and spiritual ends and use all possible means to attain peace and holiness, understanding that they are necessary for a genuine relationship with God.

In our pursuit of seeing the Lord, we are called to actively pursue peace with all and strive for sanctification. Without holiness, we cannot enter the presence of the holy God or truly appreciate Him. We must diligently follow after peace, using moral and spiritual means, and consecrate ourselves through holiness. This pursuit is necessary, as peace cannot be maintained while compromising with the ungodly. Therefore, we must embrace peace and holiness together, diligently seeking them as essential for a genuine relationship with God.

To see the Lord, we must diligently pursue peace with all and strive for sanctification. Following after peace means actively seeking moral and spiritual ends, while sanctification requires consecration and becoming holy as God is holy. Without holiness, we cannot enter into the presence of the holy God, and it is through holiness that we are able to appreciate and enjoy Him. Therefore, our part is to put on His holiness and be sanctified, so that we may have communion with Him both in this life and in the life to come.
